title: How do you monitor automated deployments to ensure success?

content:
Automated deployment monitoring involves tracking the application update process in CI/CD pipelines to ensure deployment reliability and success. Its importance lies in minimizing failure risks, maintaining service continuity, and it is widely used in cloud-native environments such as Kubernetes, supporting rapid iteration and efficient operation and maintenance.

Core components include log aggregation (e.g., Fluentd), metrics monitoring (e.g., Prometheus), health checks (e.g., Kubernetes probes), and alert systems. In principle, it analyzes deployment status in real-time and triggers automatic rollbacks. It is characterized by high observability, significantly reducing human errors, improving system stability and DevOps efficiency, and having a positive impact on continuous delivery.

Implementation steps: Integrate monitoring tools into CI/CD pipelines, define key metrics (such as deployment time, error rate), set alert thresholds (such as notifications via email or Slack), and perform post-deployment health verification (such as automated testing). Typical scenarios include blue-green deployment, and business value is reflected in shortening fault recovery time, improving success rates, and reducing costs.
